snippet: The closely watched experimental drug, dexpramipexole, failed to work in a late-stage clinical trial, disappointing medical experts.
abstract: Biogen ends development of closely watched experimental drug dexpramipexole, which medical experts hoped would be useful tool to treat amyotrophic lateral sclerlosis, known as ALS or Lou Gehrig's disease, after it fails to work in a late-stage clinical trial.
lead_paragraph: The closely watched experimental drug, dexpramipexole, failed to work in a late-stage clinical trial, disappointing medical experts.

headline.main: Biogen Idec Gives Up on Drug for Lou Gehrig’s Disease
headline.print_headline: Biogen Idec Gives Up on Drug for Lou Gehrig’s Disease
